name: Counterfactual Regulatory Change
description: What-if reasoning when a rule is proposed but not yet active

theory.natural_language: Current rule: contractors must submit weekly timesheets. Proposed rule: switch to bi-weekly timesheets starting next quarter. Today is still current quarter. Contractor Lina follows weekly submissions. Contractor Max asks what changes if the proposal takes effect.

queries.natural_language: Is Lina compliant under the current rule?

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes. She submits weekly timesheets as required now.
expected_answer.explanation: current_rule REQUIRES weekly_timesheet ∧ Lina SUBMITS weekly_timesheet

queries.natural_language: Counterfactually, what would Lina need to do next quarter?

expected_answer.natural_language: She would need to switch to bi-weekly submissions when the proposed rule becomes effective.

queries.natural_language: Is Max required to change submissions today?

expected_answer.natural_language: No. The proposal is not yet active this quarter.
expected_answer.explanation: today IN current_quarter ∧ proposed_rule not yet effective
